column1: Taixing (simplified Chinese: 泰兴; traditional Chinese: 泰興; pinyin: Tàixīng) is a county-level city under the administration of Taizhou
column3: China. It is located in the Yangtze River Delta
column4: bordering the prefecture-level cities of Nantong to the east

column1: The southern Hailin county was taken away to create Taixing in 938
column2: it was administrated by Taizhou. It was under the jurisdiction of Yangzhou during the era of Yuan and Ming
column3: but was transferred to Tongzhou later. It was returned to Yangzhou in 1953
column4: and became a county-level city in 1992. It was transferred to Taizhou in 1996.

column2: to the victims of a ferry disaster
